label: A_tI4_139_e-001
title: Hypothetical BCT5 Si Structure
comments: The bct5 structure is a tetragonal analog of the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cF8_227_a-001}{diamond ($A4$) structure}, with 5-fold coordination. It was proposed in (Boyer, 1991) as a low-energy metastable phase of silicon, based on first-principles calculations and model potentials. (Gerbig, 2012) found evidence of this structure in strained silicon.
